CONVERSATION GROUP: BK adding character's name to help with later Sherm reference

BK WOTC rewrite of line to make it less modern sounding.
BK I figured there must be others in Luskan that love books as much as I do... so I opened my collection to the public. Strangely, I don't get too many visitors.
BK Bertrand was a good friend of mine. His business often left him in the possession of rare tomes, and he contributed many tomes to my library.
In the days preceding Bertrand's death, an unassuming person took a peculiar interest in some of our books, particularly those detailing demons.
However, on the morrow after the murder, this same person came in suddenly looking for information about arcane jewels.
Yes. I believe that Bertrand's murder had nothing to do with who he was, but rather the jewelry he possessed.
If a demon cult is acquiring these jewels, no doubt they wish to use it to summon and bind a demon into their service.
The specific jewel he asked about has several uses... one of which is as a component to bind a demon to this realm.
The herbalist, Sherm. Don't let his demeanor fool you - he's deceptively intelligent. And I don't really trust what he has going on in that shop of his. If you're going to confront him, be careful.
BK ...and you did NOT hear this from me.

Hah hah! I sincerely doubt that you've come across anything we'd be interested in. We are one of the most respected libraries on the Sword Coast. Still, if you come across anything particularly arcane in nature, I'll take a look.
This line was return referring to a man but Drenna is female
This is quite a find here. Yes, I believe we are interested. Though I see it is only one of a three volume set. You will be fairly paid for this, yes. It's just a shame that you only have one...
Here you are. Of course, were you to come across the full series, that would indeed be most impressive..
I came across Volume II in an old abandoned castle.
An abandoned castle? I'm surprised a work of such value would be left behind.
